categories.title: Potty Training
categories.description: Quick routines to build consistent bathroom habits.

items.title: Stick To A Schedule
items.summary: Take your puppy to the same potty spot first thing in the morning, after meals, naps, and play.
tips: Use a leash so you can reward in place immediately after they go.
Keep a potty log to spot patterns and tighten the schedule.

items.title: Limit Free Roaming
items.summary: Until potty habits are solid, rotate between crate time, supervised play, and potty breaks.
tips: If an accident happens, interrupt gently and bring them outside without scolding.
Increase freedom only after three clean days in a row.

categories.title: Crate Training
categories.description: Build a cozy den that your puppy chooses on their own.

items.title: Positive Introductions
items.summary: Start with the door open and drop treats inside while you sit nearby.
tips: Feed meals in the crate and place a chew toy inside to create positive associations.
Close the door for short intervals only when they are relaxed.

items.title: Practice Short Separations
items.summary: Gradually build duration while you stay in the room, then step away briefly.
tips: Pair departures with a stuffed Kong so the crate stays rewarding.
Return before whining escalates to keep success momentum.

categories.title: Biting & Nipping
categories.description: Redirect mouthy behavior into calm choices.

items.title: Offer Legal Chews
items.summary: Keep tug toys and chews ready so you can swap the moment teeth touch skin or clothes.
tips: Rotate toy textures often to keep them interesting.
Praise when they re-engage with the chew instead of your hands.

items.title: Interrupt & Reset
items.summary: If redirection fails twice, give a quick calm break in the crate or behind a gate.
tips: Avoid yelling - stay neutral to prevent adding excitement.
End the break when they take a breath and relax, then reset play calmly.
